# Backend Configuration Template
# Copy this file to .env ONLY if auto-detection doesn't work
# This template is for manual configuration when automatic detection fails

# Backend URL for the Flask server
# For iOS Simulator: http://127.0.0.1:5000 or http://localhost:5000
# For Android Emulator: http://10.0.x.x:5000
# For Physical Devices: http://YOUR_LOCAL_IP:5000 (e.g., http://192.168.x.xx:5000)
BACKEND_URL=

# Alternative configuration - specify just the host IP
# The app will automatically add :5000 port
BACKEND_HOST=

# WebSocket URL (optional, will be auto-generated from BACKEND_URL if not specified)
WEBSOCKET_URL=

# Development mode (true/false)
DEV_MODE=true

# Auto-detect backend (true/false) - if true, app will try to find backend automatically
AUTO_DETECT_BACKEND=true

# Network interface for development (optional)
# Use this if you have multiple network interfaces
DEV_NETWORK_INTERFACE=

# Example configurations for different scenarios:
# 
# For development on localhost:
# BACKEND_URL=http://localhost:5000
# 
# For development with physical Android device:
# BACKEND_URL=http://192.168.x.xx:5000
# 
# For Android emulator:
# BACKEND_URL=http://10.0.x.x:5000
# 
# For iOS simulator:
# BACKEND_URL=http://127.0.0.1:5000
